title: Paintbrush 1.1 for Mac
description:
Paintbrush description	Download

Paintbrush is a Cocoa-based paint program for Mac OS X, similar to Microsoft Paint and the now-defunct MacPaint. 

The project&#039;s ultimate goal is to recreate the basic functionality of Microsoft Paint, which has been noticeably absent from Mac OS X for years. 

Paintbrush can open and save to most major image formats, including BMP, JPEG, PNG, and GIF.

Paintbrush is not intended to replace Photoshop or other high-end image editors. Instead, it aims to fill the need for a basic, streamlined editor for those times when you just feel the need to doodle.



What&#039;s New in This Release:

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Added in 1.1:
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Fill tool completely rewritten, resulting in a significant speed gain
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Limited undo stack to 10 undos (reducing chance for memory overflow)
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· SUBMITTED: Grid overlay now available
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Zooming image will not cause funny scrolling to occur
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· By default, images created by Paintbrush will open in Paintbrush in the Finder
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Bomb tool animation can be immediately completed by pressing ESC
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Preliminary support for Shift key in Selection tool
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Text insertion uses front color, automatically opens font panel
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Color accuracy has been improved (now using calibrated instead of device colors)
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Added button to switch foreground and background colors
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Toolbox shortcut key changed to better represent functionality
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Fixed in 1.1:
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· REQUESTED: No longer uses wrong size when opening certain JPEGs
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· REQUESTED: Second click on either color well hides panel, avoiding confusion
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Pastes in correct bottom-left corner when zoomed
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Changing colors during bomb animation will not change the color being used
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Undo no longer makes duplicates of image clippings when used with Selection tool
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Paste no longer occasionally places image in Toolbox instead of the document window
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Scrollbars in correct location after zoom, opening large images...
